summary: Diaz Lanz is identified as a former Cuban Air Force officer. According to one document, an FBI source in Jamaica reported that a Cuban diplomat, Enrique Montero, alleged that Diaz Lanz, along with other Cuban exiles, was involved in the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. This allegation was reportedly made during a Communist Party meeting in the Cuban Embassy. Other documents do not directly mention Diaz Lanz's involvement in the JFK assassination but provide context about Cuban exiles and resistance activities against the Castro regime during the early 1960s.
significance: Diaz Lanz is significant due to the allegation linking him to the JFK assassination, although this information comes from a single source and should be treated with caution. His background as a former Cuban Air Force officer places him within the context of Cuban exiles who opposed the Castro regime, a group that has been subject to scrutiny in connection to the assassination.
